definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A brother initiate who is a skilled chef demonstrates vegetarian cooking . vegetarian stuffed cabbage.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪课上，厨师师兄示范美味素食餐点的料理方法。

sentences.english: My favorite meal is pork fried noodles.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的餐点是猪肉炒面。

sentences.english: Restaurants are great, but can they beat a homecooked meal?
sentences.chinese: 餐馆好虽好，但上馆子会比吃自家烹调的餐点更好吗？

sentences.english: She will also oversee the preparation of small dinners and snacks for the Bush family.
sentences.chinese: 她还负责为布什总统一家准备餐点。

sentences.english: So why not try sharing a relatively inexpensive dinner or picnic.
sentences.chinese: 因此，何不试试相对便宜的餐点或野餐呢？

sentences.english: Microwave dinners and instant foods make cooking at home a snap.
sentences.chinese: 微波炉晚餐和实时餐点使得在家烧饭省事又快速。

sentences.english: Ruben, the host, made all the arrangements and requested his wife to prepare dinner and make Bernard feel at home.
sentences.chinese: 并要太太准备丰富的餐点，让伯纳感到宾至如归。

sentences.english: Life, like a box of chocolates, is full of sweetness as well as bitterness.
sentences.chinese: 生活是一道甜酸苦辣混合的餐点。

sentences.english: You can go on a 3-day fruit fast to cleanse your body.
sentences.chinese: 你可以进行为期3天的水果餐点，快速净化你的身体。

definition: tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
afternoon tea (light afternoon meal, typically pastries with tea or coffee)
